Absolutely! Here are some recommendations for getting involved in sustainability initiatives at the University of Exeter:

1. Check out the Sustainability Team's website for information on current initiatives and events related to sustainability. You can also follow them on social media for updates.
2. Attend the annual Sustainability Showcase, which is a great opportunity to learn about sustainability initiatives happening across the university and to connect with like-minded individuals.
3. Join the Green Consultants program to gain training and experience in sustainability consulting.
4. Join a student society that focuses on sustainability, such as the Green Group or GeogSoc.
5. Participate in Student Switch Off campaigns and contests to reduce energy consumption.
6. Join the Sustainable Students program to engage in sustainability research projects or to develop your own sustainability initiative.
7. Participate in Sustainability Challenges and work on developing sustainable solutions for real-world problems.

These are just a few ways to get involved in sustainability initiatives at the University of Exeter. I would encourage you to explore the resources available and find something that aligns with your interests and passions!
